text: I work on the infrastructure to help, support and enhance the work of our team. Ultimately leading them to be able to create without constraints.

I believe that life is found in adventures, where you learn, make discoveries and push beyond your limits. My mission here is to make the web a place where others can experience exactly that, thereby making an impact with what I do.

My mission is to expose simplicity—through my code as much as through my communication. I want to increase people's understanding by breaking down complex structures for and with them. Through discovery and synthesis, I want to reveal the core of what really counts and with that create the things which people truly need.

I want to foster understanding and develop real and meaningful connections between people. Embracing these values myself, I strive to create software that excites people because it gives them the feeling that someone really gets them.

I want to help make software that is accessible, sustainable and serves real people’s actual needs. While doing so I want to be aware of my own biases and pay special attention to the voices and needs of marginalised people, be they users, peers or clients.
I strive to give people the knowledge, structure and tools they need to harness the power of language and communication.

I want to reach people emotionally. Which means: At Nothing Interactive I want to highlight the value and opportunity in any task. I want to generate motivation for people around me. And with Nothing Interactive I want to strive to create products that have a positive impact on the daily life of it users and I want to strive for a purely user-centred pipeline reachable only with an honest and open communication with our clients.

I want to design products that build an emotional connection between people. I want to bring joy in the life by creating beautiful interfaces that are easy to use. I want to understand the people that will use our products, so I can provide them a solution that meet their needs. I want to place my design skills and creativity in service of a development of a more appealing technology that anyone could use regardless their age or skills. I want to place myself at the intersection of design and technology so I can understand it better and I can translate it into a visual language. I also want to develop myself as a person and keep on learning and improving, so I can have a positive impact around me. At work as well as in life in general.
I want to make people happy by making software and experiences that fulfil their needs.
I want to build bridges between people. By creating connections across different disciplines and between different points of view, I seek to make life simpler—for everybody involved.
